meanings.definition: Not respectable; having a bad reputation.
meanings.sent1: The old, disreputable house on the corner was avoided by everyone in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The disreputable behavior of the suspect made the police officer suspicious.
meanings.sent3: Despite his disreputable appearance, the clown brought joy to the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: The disreputable rumors about her past haunted her like shadows in the night.
meanings.sent5: The disreputable smell coming from the dumpster made everyone hold their noses.

meanings.definition: Bringing or deserving disgrace or shame.
meanings.sent1: The disreputable actions of the bully caused distress among the students.
meanings.sent2: She felt disreputable after lying to her best friend about the stolen cookie.
meanings.sent3: The disreputable cat knocked over the vase and looked guilty as sin.
meanings.sent4: His disreputable behavior at the party painted him as the black sheep of the family.
meanings.sent5: The disreputable decision to cheat on the test left a stain on his conscience.
